info.title: CISCO-IPMROUTE-MIB MIB API
info.description:
The MIB module for management of IP Multicast routing,
    but independent of the specific multicast routing protocol
    in use.

⚠️ **IMPORTANT - MIB DATA ACCESS**:
This YANG model exists for SMIv2-to-YANG translation purposes, but MIB data on IOS-XE devices is primarily accessed via **SNMP protocol**, not RESTCONF.

**RESTCONF Limitation**: Many MIB paths may return 404 errors via RESTCONF `/data` endpoints because the device exposes MIB data through SNMP, not the YANG datastore.

**Recommended Access Methods**:
- Use SNMP (v2c/v3) to query MIB data directly
- Use NETCONF `<get>` operations for devices supporting YANG-modeled MIB access
- Check device capabilities: some newer IOS-XE versions may support limited RESTCONF access to specific MIBs

**YANG Model Purpose**: These YANG models define the structure of SNMP MIBs in YANG format for tooling compatibility, but do not guarantee RESTCONF data availability.

get.description: Retrieve ciscoIpMRoute operational data from MIB
Retrieve ciscoIpMRouteHeartBeatTable operational data from MIB
Retrieve list of ciscoIpMRouteHeartBeatEntry entries from MIB
Retrieve specific ciscoIpMRouteHeartBeatEntry entry by key from MIB
Retrieve list of ciscoIpMRouteHeartBeatEntry entries from MIB
Retrieve specific ciscoIpMRouteHeartBeatEntry entry by key from MIB

CISCO-IPMROUTE-MIB_CISCO-IPMROUTE-MIB.description:
Maintains a count of the number of entries in the
          ipMRouteTable.

ciscoIpMRouteNumberOfEntries.description:
Maintains a count of the number of entries in the
          ipMRouteTable.

ciscoIpMRouteHeartBeatGroupAddr.description:
Multicast group address used to receive heartbeat
            packets.

ciscoIpMRouteHeartBeatSourceAddr.description:
Source address of the last multicast heartbeat packet
            received.

ciscoIpMRouteHeartBeatInterval.description:
Number of seconds in which a Cisco multicast router
            expects a valid heartBeat packet from a source.  This
            value must be a multiple of 10.

ciscoIpMRouteHeartBeatWindowSize.description:
Number of ciscoIpMRouteHeartBeatInterval intervals a
            Cisco multicast router waits before checking if expected
            number of heartbeat packets are received or not.

ciscoIpMRouteHeartBeatCount.description:
Number of time intervals where multicast packets were
            received in the last ciscoIpMRouteHeartBeatWindowSize
            intervals.

ciscoIpMRouteHeartBeatMinimum.description:
The minimal number of heartbeat packets expected in the
            last ciscoIpMRouteHeartBeatWindowSize intervals. If
            ciscoIpMRouteHeartBeatCount falls below this value, an
            SNMP trap/notification, if configured, will be sent to the
            NMS.

ciscoIpMRouteHeartBeatAlertTime.description:
The value of sysUpTime on the most recent occasion at
            which a missing IP multicast heartbeat condition occured
            for the group address specified in this entry.  If no such
            condition have occurred since the last re-initialization
            of the local management subsystem, then this object
            contains a zero value.

ciscoIpMRouteHeartBeatStatus.description:
This object is used to create a new row or delete an
            existing row in this table.

ciscoIpMRoute.description:
Maintains a count of the number of entries in the
          ipMRouteTable.

ciscoIpMRouteNumberOfEntries.description:
Maintains a count of the number of entries in the
          ipMRouteTable.

ciscoIpMRouteHeartBeatTable.description:
The (conceptual) table listing sets of IP Multicast
        heartbeat parameters.  If no IP Multicast heartbeat is
        configured, this table would be empty.

ciscoIpMRouteHeartBeatGroupAddr.description:
Multicast group address used to receive heartbeat
            packets.

ciscoIpMRouteHeartBeatSourceAddr.description:
Source address of the last multicast heartbeat packet
            received.

ciscoIpMRouteHeartBeatInterval.description:
Number of seconds in which a Cisco multicast router
            expects a valid heartBeat packet from a source.  This
            value must be a multiple of 10.

ciscoIpMRouteHeartBeatWindowSize.description:
Number of ciscoIpMRouteHeartBeatInterval intervals a
            Cisco multicast router waits before checking if expected
            number of heartbeat packets are received or not.

ciscoIpMRouteHeartBeatCount.description:
Number of time intervals where multicast packets were
            received in the last ciscoIpMRouteHeartBeatWindowSize
            intervals.

ciscoIpMRouteHeartBeatMinimum.description:
The minimal number of heartbeat packets expected in the
            last ciscoIpMRouteHeartBeatWindowSize intervals. If
            ciscoIpMRouteHeartBeatCount falls below this value, an
            SNMP trap/notification, if configured, will be sent to the
            NMS.

ciscoIpMRouteHeartBeatAlertTime.description:
The value of sysUpTime on the most recent occasion at
            which a missing IP multicast heartbeat condition occured
            for the group address specified in this entry.  If no such
            condition have occurred since the last re-initialization
            of the local management subsystem, then this object
            contains a zero value.

ciscoIpMRouteHeartBeatStatus.description:
This object is used to create a new row or delete an
            existing row in this table.

          Multicast heartbeat parameters.
